sentences: See on parim raamat, mida ma olen lugenud.
context: The Estonian word 'parim' is the superlative form of 'hea' (good). It means 'the best' or 'most excellent'. This word typically appears in its basic singular nominative form as shown, but it can also be declined into different cases and numbers. For example: parima (genitive/illative), parimad (nominative plural), parimate (genitive plural). It's used to indicate the highest degree of quality or excellence among options being compared.
